pullRequest.title: JEP 371 implementation part 3
pullRequest.bodyText:
This change adds code to handle ClassOption.STRONG

For hidden class defined without ClassOption.STRONG,
set its classLoader to anon classLoader. J9_FINDCLASS_FLAG_ANON is
set for such classes.
For hidden class defined with ClassOption.STRONG, set its
classLoader to its hostclass's classLoader. J9_FINDCLASS_FLAG_ANON is
not set for such classes.
With 1) and 2) the field that I added in my previous change
ROMClassSegmentAllocationStrategy::__allocNewSeg is not necessary
anymore. Remove this field.
Add hidden class in 2) to the classTable of its hostclass's
ClassLoader. In this way, the current balanced GC code is able to
find such class when iterating through the classTable.

Adding hidden classes to the classTable makes it not sharable via
shared classes cache, as its name won't be unique across JVMs. The
change in 4) is temporary if we finally decide to change balance
GC to scan the ram segment like other collectors.
Issue #9328
Fixes #10249
Depends on eclipse/omr#5453
Signed-off-by: Hang Shao hangshao@ca.ibm.com

beforeCommit.message:
JEP 371 implementation part 3

This change adds code to handle ClassOption.STRONG
1) For hidden class defined without ClassOption.STRONG, 
set its classLoader to anon classLoader.
2) For hidden class defined with ClassOption.STRONG, set its 
classLoader to its hostclass's classLoader.
3) With 1) and 2) the field that I added in my previous change
ROMClassSegmentAllocationStrategy::__allocNewSeg is not necessary
anymore. Remove this field.
4) Add hidden class in 2) to the classTable of its hostclass's 
ClassLoader. In this way, the current balanced GC code is able to 
find such class when iterating through the classTable. By default, 
do not return hidden class from
hashClassTableAt()/hashClassTableAtString(). 
Added a new version of the these hashTable find API in case we 
want to find hidden class.

Adding hidden classes to the classTable makes it not sharable via 
shared classes cache, as its name won't be unique across JVMs. The 
change in 4) is temporary if we finally decide to change balance 
GC to scan the ram segment like other collectors. 

Issue #9328
Fixes #10249

Signed-off-by: Hang Shao <hangshao@ca.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: Hidden classes have the same lifecycle as the classloader they are loaded in.  Why do they need UTF8 interning disabled?
Can you fill in this comment with content?  I know existing code does a poor job of this but new functions should get proper docs

Given we're reserving a U_32 for the flags, let's call it flags so it's clear there may be others in the future

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            hashClassTableAtWithFlag(J9ClassLoader *classLoader, U_8 *className, UDATA classNameLength, U_32 flag)
          
          
            
            hashClassTableAtWithFlag(J9ClassLoader *classLoader, U_8 *className, UDATA classNameLength, U_32 flags)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -273,7 +273,7 @@ hashClassTableNew(J9JavaVM *javaVM, U_32 initialSize)
 }
 
 J9Class *
-hashClassTableAt(J9ClassLoader *classLoader, U_8 *className, UDATA classNameLength)
+hashClassTableAtWithFlag(J9ClassLoader *classLoader, U_8 *className, UDATA classNameLength, U_32 flag)

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            hashClassTableAtStringWithFlag(J9ClassLoader *classLoader, j9object_t stringObject, U_32 flag)
          
          
            
            hashClassTableAtStringWithFlag(J9ClassLoader *classLoader, j9object_t stringObject, U_32 flags)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -524,7 +538,7 @@ hashPkgTableNextDo(J9HashTableState *walkState)
 }
 
 J9Class *
-hashClassTableAtString(J9ClassLoader *classLoader, j9object_t stringObject)
+hashClassTableAtStringWithFlag(J9ClassLoader *classLoader, j9object_t stringObject, U_32 flag)

afterCommit.message:
JEP 371 implementation part 3

This change adds code to handle ClassOption.STRONG
1) For hidden class defined without ClassOption.STRONG, 
set its classLoader to anon classLoader. J9_FINDCLASS_FLAG_ANON is 
set for such classes. 
2) For hidden class defined with ClassOption.STRONG, set its 
classLoader to its hostclass's classLoader. J9_FINDCLASS_FLAG_ANON 
is not set for such classes.
3) With 1) and 2) the field that I added in my previous change
ROMClassSegmentAllocationStrategy::__allocNewSeg is not necessary
anymore. Remove this field.
4) Add hidden class in 2) to the classTable of its hostclass's 
ClassLoader. In this way, the current balanced GC code is able to 
find such class when iterating through the classTable. 

Adding hidden classes to the classTable makes it not sharable via 
shared classes cache, as its name won't be unique across JVMs. The 
change in 4) is temporary if we finally decide to change balance 
GC to scan the ram segment like other collectors. A flag can be 
used to control whether to skip hidden class when iterating the 
class table. 

Issue #9328
Fixes #10249

Signed-off-by: Hang Shao <hangshao@ca.ibm.com>

classLoader to its hostclass's classLoader. J9_FINDCLASS_FLAG_ANON 
is not set for such classes.
3) With 1) and 2) the field that I added in my previous change
ROMClassSegmentAllocationStrategy::__allocNewSeg is not necessary
anymore. Remove this field.
4) Add hidden class in 2) to the classTable of its hostclass's 
ClassLoader. In this way, the current balanced GC code is able to 
find such class when iterating through the classTable. 

Adding hidden classes to the classTable makes it not sharable via 
shared classes cache, as its name won't be unique across JVMs. The 
change in 4) is temporary if we finally decide to change balance 
GC to scan the ram segment like other collectors. A flag can be 
used to control whether to skip hidden class when iterating the 
class table. 

Issue #9328
Fixes #10249

Signed-off-by: Hang Shao <hangshao@ca.ibm.com>
